qas.question: Where are tornadoes most common on Earth?
During which seasons are tornados most common?
Which regions experience the worst flooding in the US?
Which region experiences the worst droughts in the US?
What type of disasters affects the western US every year?
Where tornadoes least common on earth?
What are most common in the summer and fall?
Destructive hurricanes occur along the West Coast and where else?
The Northwest and what other region experienced the worst flooding in the US?
What disaster affects the Southwest every year?

context: In <a0_0><b5_0>central portions of the U.S.<b5_0/><a0_0/>, <b6_0>tornadoes<b6_0/> are more common than anywhere else on Earth and touch down most commonly in the <a1_0>spring and summer<a1_0/>. Deadly and destructive hurricanes occur almost every year along the Atlantic seaboard and the <b7_0>Gulf of Mexico<b7_0/>. The <a2_0>Appalachian region and the <b8_0>Midwest<b8_0/><a2_0/> experience the worst floods, though virtually no area in the U.S. is immune to flooding. The <a3_0>Southwest<a3_0/> has the worst droughts; one is thought to have lasted over 500 years and to have hurt Ancestral Pueblo peoples. The West is affected by large <a4_0><b9_0>wildfires<b9_0/><a4_0/> each year.
